alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 28 at 5:50PM MST until March 01 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY LATE MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EARLY EVENING FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO VERY WINDY AND DRY CONDITIONS... .Dry and windy conditions will return on Wednesday afternoon across the east-central plains, allowing critical fire weather conditions to return for several hours. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST WEDNESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 11 AM to 6 PM MST Wednesday. * AREA AND TIMING...East Central Plains (Zone 126) from 11 AM Wednesday morning through 6 PM MST Wednesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph on Wednesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
